data: Nurse to initiate the Immediate Post Procedure phase. These orders continue on the inpatient unit
Discharge home when discharge criteria is met
Do not discharge patient until radiologist / MRP reviews post lung biopsy chest x-ray and consults with patient
Patient to see radiologist in 1 week
Give Patient information pamphlet on discharge if applicable
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 1 hour, then PRN
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour or until discharged home or to ward
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 3 hour, then PRN
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 3 hour, then routine
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour, then q1h for 1 hour, then routine
q15min for 1 hour, then q30min for 1 hour or until discharged home or to ward
In the event of post-procedural bleed of the puncture site, compress firmly with fingers for 10 minutes
Notify provider immediately if change in vital signs of +/- 20%, any bleeding at puncture site, pain not relieved by analgesia, nausea or significant changes in patient status

Notify nephrologist if gross hematuria present, BP greater than 160/100 mmHg, hypotension, heart rate greater than 100 bpm, vital signs fall below baseline or persistent pain post-procedure following renal biopsy
PRN, Indwelling if unable to void
For brachial sheaths or sheaths used for prosthetic graft DO NOT use clamp. Use manual compression only
Bedrest for 4 hours post renal biopsy and for 1 hour post liver biopsy
1 hour post-procedure with biopsy side down
1 hour post-procedure, may elevate head of bed 30 degrees
Keep Right Leg straight while on bedrest x 2 hour post sheath removal, then activity as tolerated. May raise head of bed up to 10 degrees
